result.execSummary:
The defendant Faith M. Liesch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Payment of costs + fees + DNA Surcharge- payment to be worked out with agent.
Prohibited from providing any day care services to any other child.
Payment of restitution if claim is made. Any other assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent. DNA Sample Due: August 16, 2022.

timeConds.notes: 60 days conditional jail time, without good time but with huber if in compliance with jail rules and regulations. Deft to report to the MCJ no later than 7pm on August 16, 2022. Credit for 0 days time served.

records.addlTxt:
1:45 PM Prosecuting attorney Robert James Mraz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Faith M. Liesch in court.  Attorney Travis A. Crowell in court for Faith M. Liesch. 
Court calls case.
Atty spks- case has been resolved. 
Atty provides plea form.
ADA heard on agreement.
Atty agrees.
Victim rights compliance.
ADA reads charge on Count 1 of the amended information. 
Court arraigns Deft.
Deft enters No Contest. 
Non-citizen advisory.
Elements of offense.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Deft understands.
Atty satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds Deft guilty on Count 1 of the amended information. 
ADA heard on sentencing.
Atty heard on sentencing.
Court heard on factors.
Court impose and stayed: 9 Month County Jail and places the deft on probation for 1 year. 
Conditions of probation: 
Payment of costs + fees + DNA Surcharge= Payment to  be worked out with agent. 
60 days conditional jail time, without good time but with huber if in compliance with jail rules and regulations. 
Deft to report to the MCJ no later than 7pm on August 16, 2022.
Credit for 0 days time served. 
Payment of restitution if claim is made. 
Prohibited from providing day care services to any other child.
Any other assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent. 
DNA Sample Due: August 16, 2022. 
Appeal rights.
2:13 PM

Copy of info
Waives reading
Pleads n/g
Requests STC 
3:31PM
Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
